examples
Class Bigconfig

java.lang.Object
  examples.Bigconfig

public class Bigconfig
extends java.lang.Object

A kodkod encoding of bigconfig.als: 

  module internal/bigconfig
  
  abstract sig Site {}
  sig HQ, Sub extends Site {}
 
  sig Router {
  site: Site,
  link: set Router
  }
 
  pred invariants() {
  -- every site has at least one router  
  Site in Router.site
  
  -- links are symmetric and non-reflexive
  link = ~link 
  no link & iden
  }
 
  pred subsConnectedToHQ() {
  -- every sub location is connected to an HQ location at the given time
  site.Sub in (site.HQ).link
  }
 
  pred connectedSites(sites: set Site) {
  -- all sites in the given set are connected to each other  
  all s: sites | sites - s in ((site.s).ˆlink).site
  }
 
  pred show() {
  invariants() && subsConnectedToHQ() && connectedSites(Site) 
  }

Author:
Emina Torlak

Returns the invariants predicate.

Returns:
pred invariants() { -- every site has at least one router Site in Router.site -- links are symmetric and non-reflexive link = ~link no link & iden }

connectedSites

public Formula connectedSites(Expression sites)
Returns the connectedSites predicate.

Returns:
pred connectedSites(sites: set Site) { -- all sites in the given set are connected to each other all s: sites | sites - s in ((site.s).^link).site }

show

public Formula show()
Returns the show predicate.

Returns:
pred show() { invariants() && subsConnectedToHQ() && connectedSites(Site) }

bounds

public Bounds bounds(int hqNum,
                     int subNum,
                     int routerNum)
Returns a bounds with the given number of hqs and subs. The parameter routerNum designates the total number of routers in the universe.

Returns:
bounds
requires:
hqNum > 0 && subNum > 0
hqNum + subNum <= routers
